com.eemi.ext4j.client.util

Class Cookies

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eemi.ext4j.client.util.Cookies

  • public class Cookies
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for setting/reading values from browser cookies. Values can be written using the set method. Values can be read using the get method. A cookie can be invalidated on the client machine using the clear method.
    Author:
    alainekambi

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void clear(java.lang.String name)
      Removes a cookie with the provided name from the browser if found by setting its expiration date to sometime in the past.
      static void clear(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String path)
      Removes a cookie with the provided name from the browser if found by setting its expiration date to sometime in the past.
      static java.lang.String get(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the cookie value for the specified name; null if the cookie name does not exist.
      static java.lang.String set(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
      Creates a cookie with the specified name and value.
      static java.lang.String set(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value, java.lang.String path)
      Creates a cookie with the specified name and value.
      static java.lang.String set(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value, java.lang.String path, java.lang.String domain)
      Creates a cookie with the specified name and value.
      static java.lang.String set(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value, java.lang.String path, java.lang.String domain, boolean secure)
      Creates a cookie with the specified name and value.

        public static void clear(java.lang.String name)

        name - , The name of the cookie to remove

      • clear

        public static void clear(java.lang.String name,
         java.lang.String path)
        Removes a cookie with the provided name from the browser if found by setting its expiration date to sometime in the past.
        Parameters:
        name - , The name of the cookie to remove
        path - , The path for the cookie. This must be included if you included a path while setting the cookie.

        Returns:

      • set

        public static java.lang.String set(java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String value)
        Creates a cookie with the specified name and value. Additional settings for the cookie may be optionally specified (for example: expiration, access restriction, SSL).
